excerpt: Enduring 16th-century Spanish fortification atop a promontory with cannons pointing seaward.
detail_description: Castillo San Felipe del Morro, also known as El Morro, is a 16th-century Spanish fortification located on a promontory in Old San Juan. The fort features cannons pointing seaward and boasts an impressive display of military defense with four levels of cannon-bearing batteries rising 140 feet from the sea. Visitors can enjoy breathtaking views of the shore and explore the expansive grassy lawn surrounding the fort.
name: Castillo San Felipe del Morro
address: 501 Calle Norzagaray, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Old San Juan is home to the San Juan National Historic Site, with buildings dating from the 16th century, including the San Felipe del Morro and San Cristóbal fortresses and the old city walls. The Bautista Cathedral houses the tomb of Spanish explorer Juan Ponce de León. Brightly colored houses line cobbled streets and shady plazas, alongside cool cocktail bars and renowned Caribbean fusion restaurants.
detail_description: Viejo San Juan, also known as Old San Juan, is a historic district with 16th-century buildings such as the San Felipe del Morro and San Cristóbal fortresses. The area features colorful houses along cobblestone streets, lively plazas, cocktail bars, and Caribbean fusion restaurants. It's also a vibrant nightlife hub with numerous bars and restaurants.
name: Viejo San Juan
address: San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Monumental fortification incorporating residence of the island's governor, dating from 16th-century.
detail_description: La Fortaleza, also known as the Palacio de Santa Catalina, is a monumental fortification and the official residence of the governor of Puerto Rico. Dating back to the 16th century, it was initially constructed as a fortress to defend against Carib Indian attacks. Over its 400-year history, La Fortaleza has undergone numerous changes and reconstructions.
name: La Fortaleza
address: 63 C. de la Fortaleza, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Walled & heavily fortified citadel built 1765-1785 & largest of the Spanish built forts in Americas.
detail_description: Begin your exploration of Old San Juan at the impressive Castillo San Cristóbal, a heavily fortified citadel constructed between 1765 and 1785. This historic fort, which is the largest among the Spanish-built forts in the Americas, played a significant role in Puerto Rico's history. It offers panoramic views of the coastline, Condado, and Old San Juan.
name: Castillo San Cristóbal
address: 501 Calle Norzagaray, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Landmark 1540 cathedral, second oldest in the Americas, holding tomb of city founder Ponce de León.
detail_description: Catedral Basilica Menor de San Juan Bautista, the second oldest cathedral in the Americas, is a 1540 landmark that houses the tomb of city founder Ponce de León. The Gothic-style cathedral can be accessed through the San Juan Gate and features beautiful stained glass windows, domes, and ceiling architecture. It offers a serene atmosphere for quiet contemplation or prayer.
name: Catedral Basilica Menor de San Juan Bautista
address: 151 Calle del Cristo, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Esteemed art museum specializing in Puerto Rican art, housed in 1920s neoclassical former hospital.
detail_description: The Museo de Arte de Puerto Rico is a prestigious art museum located in the vibrant Santurce neighborhood of San Juan. Housed in a neoclassical former hospital, the museum boasts a 130,000-sq-ft space filled with over 1000 works of art, including pieces by renowned Puerto Rican artists like Francisco Oller and Rafael Tufino. The museum's 24 exhibition galleries showcase a diverse collection of paintings, drawings, sculptures, and photographs.
name: Museo de Arte de Puerto Rico
address: 299 Avenida José de Diego, San Juan, 00909, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Paseo de la Princesa, also known as the Princess Promenade, is a vibrant pedestrian pathway located just outside the walls of Old San Juan. It offers an array of colorful artisan displays and street vendors showcasing their wares under the warm Puerto Rican sun. The promenade provides stunning views of San Juan Bay and the Atlantic Ocean, creating a truly magical and romantic atmosphere.
name: Paseo de la Princesa
address: FV7M+9CV, Paseo de la Princesa, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Popular public beach with white sand, luxury hotels & a variety of outdoor bars & cafes nearby.
detail_description: Condado Beach is a popular public beach in San Juan, Puerto Rico, known for its white sand and proximity to luxury hotels, outdoor bars, and cafes. The area is considered the most chic and stylish district of San Juan, offering trendy hotels, exclusive bars, and clubs that cater to a more mature crowd. Visitors can enjoy prime shore access at the Marriott outpost overlooking the shimmering waters of Condado Beach.
name: Condado Beach
address: San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

excerpt:
La Perla is a historical shanty town astride the northern historic city wall of Old San Juan, Puerto Rico, stretching about 650 yards along the rocky Atlantic coast immediately east of the Santa Maria Magdalena de Pazzis Cemetery and down the slope from Calle Norzagaray.
La Perla was established in the 18th century. Wikipedia.
detail_description: La Perla is a historic shanty town located along the northern city wall of Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. It was established in the 18th century and stretches about 650 yards along the rocky Atlantic coast. The area is situated east of the Santa Maria Magdalena de Pazzis Cemetery and downhill from Calle Norzagaray.
name: La Perla
address: San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: This 1949 historic destination features colonial fortifications, powder houses & old city walls.
detail_description: San Juan National Historic Site, established in 1949, is a combination of El Morro and San Cristobal forts operated by the National Park Service. The site played a crucial role in Spanish defense efforts and control of the Caribbean route for over 250 years. Visitors can explore the forts' tunnels, dungeons, ramps, and barracks while learning about their rich history.
name: San Juan National Historic Site
address: FVCG+5HX, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Plaza de Armas, located in the heart of Old San Juan, was the main square during Spanish colonial times and remains the city's focal point today. The surrounding government buildings boast vibrant colors and impressive architecture, making it a popular spot for photos. Visitors can take a break here, grab a snack, and enjoy some people-watching. The bustling plaza offers benches for relaxation, a gurgling fountain, and street performers entertaining locals and tourists.
name: Plaza de Armas
address: San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Shopping & dining locale with arched mezzanines, seasonal decor & a variety of stores & restaurants.
detail_description: Plaza Las Américas is a modern indoor shopping plaza in San Juan, offering a variety of stores and restaurants for visitors to enjoy. With its arched mezzanines and seasonal decor, the mall provides a perfect setting for some retail therapy or to pick up any forgotten items. While it may not offer traditional Puerto Rican souvenirs, it boasts over three hundred stores including chain outlets, the latest fashion trends, American dining options, movie theaters, and unique shops.
name: Plaza Las Américas
address: 525 Avenida F.D. Roosevelt, San Juan, 00918, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Cocktails & classic bar bites dished up in a vibrant hangout with a rustic-chic vibe.
detail_description: La Factoría is a vibrant hangout with a rustic-chic vibe that has gained international acclaim for its excellent cocktails and classic bar bites. It's a local favorite in Puerto Rico, known for introducing mixology to the island. The bar consists of four different spaces, each with its own theme, including a room filled with rum-fueled dancers and a DJ playing until late. The middle space features old-school salsa music and boasts one of the best dance floors on the island.
name: La Factoría
address: 51 C. de San José, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: After a satisfying breakfast, take a stroll from the colonial headquarters to discover the impressive San Felipe del Morro castle, also referred to as El Morro. This magnificent fortress, located at the north-western edge of Old San Juan, holds centuries of Puerto Rican history within its walls. As you stand outside the fortification, you can feel the refreshing trade winds and enjoy breathtaking views overlooking the ocean and the Santa Maria Magdalena de Pazzis Cemetery.
name: El Morro
address: San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: This ornate 1863 cemetery overlooking the ocean is the burial spot of many famous Puerto Ricans.
detail_description: Cementerio Santa María Magdalena de Pazzis is an ornate cemetery established in 1863, offering stunning views of the ocean. It serves as the burial place for numerous renowned Puerto Ricans. Situated outside the city wall next to El Morro, it was once near a slaughterhouse and later became a settlement for slaves and rural immigrants. Despite its proximity to El Morro, this colonial-era cemetery is often overlooked by tourists.
name: Cementerio Santa María Magdalena de Pazzis
address: FV9J+R4R, Cemetery St, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: San Juan, Puerto Rico's capital and largest city, sits on the island's Atlantic coast. Its widest beach fronts the Isla Verde resort strip, known for its bars, nightclubs and casinos. Cobblestoned Old San Juan features colorful Spanish colonial buildings and 16th-century landmarks including El Morro and La Fortaleza, massive fortresses with sweeping ocean views, as well as the Paseo de la Princesa bayside promenade.
detail_description: San Juan, the capital and largest city of Puerto Rico, is a bustling coastal destination with a vibrant nightlife and rich history. The Isla Verde resort strip boasts a wide beach and lively bars, nightclubs, and casinos. In contrast, Old San Juan showcases colorful Spanish colonial buildings and 16th-century landmarks like El Morro and La Fortaleza. Visitors can stroll along the Paseo de la Princesa bayside promenade for stunning ocean views.
name: San Juan
address: Puerto Rico

detail_description: Playa Ocean Park, also known as Ocean Park Beach, is a popular destination in San Juan, Puerto Rico. Unlike other tourist spots, this beach offers a chance to interact with the locals on equal footing. It's located in an upscale neighborhood and is home to some of the city's cooler hotels. The area is beloved by locals and offers various water sports and physical activities such as volleyball, soccer, jet skiing, and windsurfing.
name: Playa Ocean Park
address: San Juan, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Condado is a highly urbanized beachfront resort, commercial, and residential district with various upscale hotels, restaurants, boutique shops, and condos in the barrio of Santurce in San Juan, the capital municipality of Puerto Rico. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Condado is a well-to-do community in Santurce, San Juan, Puerto Rico. Loiza Street connects Condado and Isla Verde and was once the main route between San Juan and the town of Loiza. Today, it's a vibrant mix of working-class businesses and modern establishments, attracting both locals and tourists.
name: Condado
address: San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Compact chapel built in the 18th century by General Don Mateo Prats & restored in the 20th century.
detail_description: Capilla del Santo Cristo de la Salud is a small chapel located on a cliff in Old San Juan, built in 1753 to honor a supposed divine intervention during a horse race. It was constructed by General Don Mateo Prats and later restored in the 20th century. The chapel remains similar to its original form and is known for its healing powers, with visitors leaving ornaments for curative purposes.
name: Capilla del Santo Cristo de la Salud
address: 1 Calle del Cristo, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: La Placita de Santurce is a vibrant and lively market square in San Juan, Puerto Rico. As the sun sets, the bars and restaurants surrounding the traditional farmers market come alive with activity. The atmosphere is bustling and energetic, making it an ideal spot for those looking to enjoy a night out. Visitors can hop from one establishment to another, savoring drinks and snacks while taking in the lively ambiance.
name: La Placita de Santurce
address: 300 C. dos Hermanos, San Juan, 00909, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Contemporary, light-filled indoor shopping center with upscale brands & restaurants on 2 floors.
detail_description: The Mall of San Juan is a modern, well-lit indoor shopping center that boasts an array of upscale brands and dining options across two floors. Since its opening in 2015, it has become one of the most impressive luxury retail destinations on the island, featuring renowned names like Nordstrom, Saks Fifth Avenue, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Jimmy Choo, and more.
name: The Mall of San Juan
address: 1000 The Mall of San Juan Blvd, San Juan, 00924, Puerto Rico

excerpt: This scenic, bustling street is lined with bars, eateries & shops & ends at a historical fortress.
detail_description: C. de la Fortaleza is a vibrant street in Old San Juan, lined with bars, eateries, and shops, leading to a historical fortress. The area includes Calle del Cristo and Calle de la Fortaleza, known for its art displays. Exploring the narrow streets and plazas of Old San Juan offers an authentic experience of Puerto Rico's culture and colorful architecture. C.
name: C. de la Fortaleza
address: San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: This Catholic church built in 1532 features Spanish gothic architecture & Catalan vaults.
detail_description: Iglesia de San José, a Catholic church built in 1532, showcases stunning Spanish Gothic architecture and Catalan vaults. The collection of buildings within the church complex spans from the medieval period to the 21st century, creating a captivating timeline of architectural history. Notable features include gray marble floors, a gold altar, highly detailed frescoes, and the visible armor of Juan Ponce de León.
name: Iglesia de San José
address: 197 Calle O'Neill, San Juan, 00918, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Santurce is a hip area home to the Puerto Rico Museum of Art, in a neoclassical building with a sculpture garden, and the Contemporary Art Museum, set in a grand former school. Colorful murals cover buildings around Calle Cerra. The Centro de Bellas Artes stages opera, theater, and concerts, while the Plaza del Mercado has a buzzing nightlife scene. Resort hotels and bars cluster around Condado Beach.
detail_description: Santurce, a vibrant neighborhood in Puerto Rico, is a haven for art enthusiasts and nightlife seekers. The area boasts the impressive Puerto Rico Museum of Art housed in an elegant neoclassical building with a charming sculpture garden. Additionally, visitors can explore the Contemporary Art Museum located in a grand former school and admire the colorful murals adorning buildings along Calle Cerra.
name: Santurce
address: San Juan, Puerto Rico

excerpt: San Cristóbal, within Old San Juan, is one of the seven subbarrios of San Juan Antiguo barrio in the municipality of San Juan in Puerto Rico. Wikipedia.
detail_description: San Cristóbal is a historic subbarrio located within Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. It is home to one of the largest fortresses in the Americas, which took over 150 years to build and was used for protecting Puerto Rico from land attacks. This fortress, along with its sister fort El Morro, offers free tours during National Parks Week from April 21st to 29th.
name: San Cristóbal
address: San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Narrow cobblestone thoroughfare lined with shops, restaurants & cafes in charming old buildings.
detail_description: Calle del Cristo is a charming narrow cobblestone street located in Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. It is known for its picturesque old buildings dating back to the 16th and 17th centuries, featuring Spanish colonial architecture with ornate balconies, wooden doors, and colorful facades. The street is lined with shops, boutiques, restaurants, and cafes offering a vibrant shopping and entertainment experience.
name: Calle del Cristo
address: San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: This large, circa-1635 gate was the main entry into the walled city during its Spanish colonial era.
detail_description: Puerta de San Juan, a large gate dating back to around 1635, served as the main entrance to the walled city during its Spanish colonial era. Located along Clara Lair Street, this pink-red exterior gate stands out amidst the surrounding brick buildings. An inscription in Latin that translates to 'Blessed is he that comes in name of the Lord' adorns the top of the door.
name: Puerta de San Juan
address: FV8J+354, Caleta de San Juan, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Museum showcasing regional/Latin American contemporary art in 1918 white-columned middle school.
detail_description: The Museo de Arte Contemporáneo de Puerto Rico (MAC) is housed in a former school building with a Georgian-style architecture. The museum features regional and Latin American contemporary art and boasts an inner courtyard with a suspended glass roof added by architect Otto Reyes Casanova in 2006. During recent hurricanes, the atrium served as a refuge providing essential supplies and charging stations.
name: Museo de Arte Contemporáneo de Puerto Rico
address: 1220 Ave. Ponce de León Esq. R.H. Todd Pda 18, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Lively Parque Isla Verde centers on Isla Verde Beach, home to numerous chic resorts and high-rise hotels. Vendors offer jet ski, parasailing, and banana boat rides, while local and global eateries, casinos, and buzzing nightclubs line the busy seafront promenade. Family-friendly Balneario de Carolina beach has a water park for kids. Inland, Luis Muñoz Marín International Airport is the island’s main travel hub.
detail_description: Parque Isla Verde is a vibrant area centered around Isla Verde Beach, which is surrounded by upscale resorts and tall hotels. The beach offers various water activities like jet skiing, parasailing, and banana boat rides. Along the bustling seafront promenade, you'll find a mix of local and international dining options, lively casinos, and energetic nightclubs. Families can enjoy the nearby Balneario de Carolina beach with its water park for kids.
name: Parque Isla Verde
address: Carolina, 00979, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Renowned rum distillery featuring historical tours, mixology classes, tastings & an outdoor patio.
detail_description: Nestled just outside San Juan in Catano, Casa BACARDÍ is a must-visit for anyone exploring Puerto Rico. This iconic rum distillery offers an engaging experience that combines history and mixology. Visitors can embark on a fascinating tour through the new visitor center, where stunning views of the harbor and Old San Juan await. The journey delves into the rich heritage of sugar cane cultivation in the Caribbean and reveals how rum production began on these vibrant islands.
name: Casa BACARDÍ
address: 200 PR-165, Cataño, 00962, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Ocean Park is an urbanized beachfront residential district with various upscale guest houses in the barrio of Santurce in San Juan, the capital municipality of Puerto Rico. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Ocean Park is an upscale beachfront community located in Santurce, San Juan, Puerto Rico. It offers a long stretch of sandy beach that extends from Condado to Barbosa Park. The area is popular for jogging and kiteboarding, and it's known for its relaxed atmosphere and vibrant beach scene. Visitors can also explore the nearby neighborhoods of Ocean Park and Condado, which are filled with shops, restaurants, and attractions. Additionally, there is ample parking available in the area for convenience.
name: Ocean Park
address: San Juan, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Small outdoor area featuring park benches, scenic views & a wall offering refuge to many pigeons.
detail_description: Parque de las Palomas, also known as Pigeon Park, is a small outdoor area located at the edge of the fortification walls in Old San Juan. It offers scenic views and park benches where visitors can relax and enjoy the company of friendly pigeons. The park is a popular spot for families, with kids having fun chasing after the pigeons that call this place home.
name: Parque de las Palomas
address: FV7J+HWR, C. Tetuán, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Traditional indoor-outdoor venue serving Puerto Rican specialties & familiar international cuisine.
detail_description: Barrachina is a historic indoor-outdoor venue located in Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. It is renowned as the birthplace of the world-famous Pina Colada, which was created by Don Ramon Portas Mingot in its magnificent courtyard back in 1963. The restaurant offers a diverse menu featuring Spanish, Puerto Rican, and international dishes that cater to every palate. Whether you're craving traditional local specialties or familiar international cuisine, Barrachina has something wonderful for everyone.
name: Barrachina
address: 104 C. de la Fortaleza, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Flavors Food Tours - San Juan offers a culinary exploration of Old San Juan, showcasing the city's pride in its food. The tour allows visitors to taste and learn about staple Puerto Rican dishes, which are a fusion of Spanish, Taino, Mexican, and American influences. In addition to the food tour, travelers can also opt for the Puerto Rico Craft Cocktail Walk.
name: Flavors Food Tours - San Juan
address: 206 C. Tetuán, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Stylish restaurant featuring an international menu with creative plates, plus cocktails & wine.
detail_description: Marmalade is a stylish restaurant in San Juan known for its international menu and creative dishes. Chef Peter Schintler has crafted an ingredient-driven menu that combines local flavors with global influences, featuring dishes like ceviche paired with tostones and vegan poblanos rellenos atop spicy black beans and mole. The restaurant offers tasting menus ranging from five to 14 courses, with the option of a plant-based menu.
name: Marmalade
address: 317 C. de la Fortaleza, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Paseo del Morro is a picturesque walkway along the historic city walls of Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. It offers stunning views of San Juan Bay and provides an ideal vantage point for witnessing breathtaking sunrises and sunsets. The walk begins at the Raices Fountain on Paseo de la Princesa and leads to the iconic Puerta de San Juan (San Juan Gate), which is the only remaining entrance from the original four gates that once provided access to the city.
name: Paseo del Morro
address: FV8J+36J, Paseo del Morro, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Balneario del Escambrón, located just minutes from Condado and Old San Juan, offers a magical experience of swimming alongside sea turtles at the Escambron Marine Park. The picturesque beach is known for its clear waters, family-friendly atmosphere, and proximity to Old San Juan. Visitors can enjoy lounging in the sand and observing playful sea turtles gracefully swimming across turquoise waters.
name: Balneario del Escambrón
address: San Juan, 00910, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Picturesque public beach featuring a coral reef, palm trees, snorkeling, scuba diving & more.
detail_description: Balneario El Escambrón is a picturesque public beach located just outside Old San Juan in Puerto Rico. It features clean sand, calm waters, and views of the nearby Fort San Felipe del Morro. The beach is ideal for families and swimmers of all ages, with lifeguards on duty and restrooms available for convenience. Additionally, it offers opportunities for snorkeling and scuba diving around its coral reef.
name: Balneario El Escambrón
address: FW86+P2V, San Juan, 00910, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Plazuela La Rogativa is a charming little square located in Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. This historic plaza is known for its beautiful sculptures and stunning views of the city and the sea. It's a great place to take a leisurely stroll, soak up some local history, and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere. The plaza is surrounded by colorful buildings and has plenty of benches where you can sit and relax while taking in the surroundings.
name: Plazuela La Rogativa
address: Cll Rafael Cordero, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Lively gathering place with cafes & kiosks offering fast food, plus terrace seating.
detail_description: Lote 23, located in Santurce, is a vibrant food park and community center that opened in late 2016. It offers a variety of dining options from kiosks and Airstream trailers, serving everything from hearty plates of pernil to light poke bowls and handmade popsicles. The park also hosts events like yoga sessions, film screenings, and artisan markets.
name: Lote 23
address: 1552 PR-25, San Juan, 00909, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Plaza Colón, located in the heart of El Viejo San Juan, is more than just a historical site. It features a bronze statue of Christopher Columbus, known for his discovery of the island. Visitors can capture Instagram-worthy photos with the statue and engage with locals or other tourists to take their pictures. Whether asking in Spanish or English, it's easy to find someone willing to help capture this memorable moment.
name: Plaza Colón
address: San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Tree-lined square close to the old city, with outdoor cafes & a monument to Christopher Columbus.
detail_description: Plaza Colón, located at the main entrance to Old San Juan, is a tree-lined square with a mix of bustling activity and tranquil spots. It was renamed to honor Christopher Columbus' 400th anniversary and features outdoor cafes and a monument dedicated to him. The plaza also includes Plazuela de la Rogativa, built in 1971, which showcases a modern sculpture depicting a religious procession that commemorates an event from 1797 when British ships attempted to take control of the colony.
name: Plaza Colón
address: FV8Q+C57, C. de la Fortaleza, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Ashford Ave exudes a Miami Beach vibe with its Caribbean twist, boasting Miami-style buildings, upscale shops, chic hotels, and seaside eateries. Strolling along this vibrant avenue offers a chance to immerse in the lively ambiance, relax at the beachfront Ventana del Mar Park, and experience an exciting evening at the iconic La Concha Resort.
name: Ashford Ave
address: San Juan, Puerto Rico

detail_description: Scuba Dogs at Escambrón Marine Park is a popular diving spot in San Juan, offering a great experience for both beginner and advanced divers. The dive masters are highly praised for their professionalism and attention to safety, providing thorough training and guidance. The marine park itself features shallow dive sites with some current, making it suitable for those who prefer not to use a wetsuit.
name: Scuba Dogs at Escambrón Marine Park
address: Parque Nacional del Tercer Milenio Esq. Calle San Agustín y Calle Normandie, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Chic restaurant serving tapas, mains & creative cocktails in an industrial-style space.
detail_description: Santaella is a stylish restaurant located in Santurce, offering a blend of tapas, main dishes, and innovative cocktails within an industrial-style space. The dining room overlooks an interior garden and features a contemporary design. Chef Jose Santaella brings his expertise from working with renowned names like Ferran Adria and Eric Ripert to create upscale market-driven cocina criolla. Guests can enjoy this elevated local cuisine for lunch at affordable prices or visit in the evening for cocktails and small plates.
name: Santaella
address: 219 C. Canals, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Coastal lagoon popular for paddle boarding & kayaking, plus seasonal manatee sightings.
detail_description: Laguna del Condado, also known as Condado Lagoon, is a beloved coastal lagoon in San Juan, located between the Condado and Miramar neighborhoods. It's a popular spot for activities like paddle boarding, kayaking, and walking. The lagoon is an estuary reserve for Caribbean Manatees and offers calm waters compared to nearby beaches. Visitors can enjoy the tranquility of this small local beach while engaging in water sports or simply taking in the peaceful atmosphere.
name: Laguna del Condado
address: San Juan, 00910, Puerto Rico

detail_description: C. de Casa Blanca, located in San Juan, Puerto Rico, is a museum house that was once the residence of Juan Ponce de Leon, Puerto Rico's first governor. Built in 1521, it remained in the hands of his descendants until the mid-18th century. The historical significance of this building led to its declaration as a historical site in 1967.
name: C. de Casa Blanca
address: San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

detail_description: DISTRITO T-Mobile, also known as the T-Mobile District, is a popular open-air events and entertainment venue located in the heart of the Convention Center District in San Juan. Since its opening in 2021, it has become a favorite destination for both locals and visitors. The five-acre complex offers a vibrant atmosphere with a variety of restaurants and bars to choose from, catering to different tastes.
name: DISTRITO T-Mobile
address: 250 Convention Blvd, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

detail_description: The Poet's Passage is a serene and vibrant art gallery and cafe in Old San Juan, showcasing the poetry, artwork, and crafts of local poet Lady Lee Andrews. Visitors can browse through the gallery for free or purchase souvenirs to support the business. On Tuesday nights, there's an Open Mic night where local poets and writers gather.
name: The Poet's Passage
address: 203 C. de la Cruz, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

excerpt: Historic square facing city hall & featuring a fountain with 4 19th-century marble statues.
detail_description: The Plaza de Armas is a beautiful historic square featuring a fountain with 4 statues from the 19th century. The plaza is in the heart of Old San Juan and is a great place to relax and take in the sights and sounds of this vibrant city.
name: Plaza de Armas
address: FV8M+48H, San Juan, 00969, Puerto Rico
